description: Students engage in a guided research activity in a selected area of population health. The project is designed to be flexible, with the specific setting, activities and outcomes which include a comprehensive written report, negotiated between the student and advisor(s). Students can enrol in this course in Semester 1, 2 or Summer Semester. Before enrolling students must obtain permission from the program coordinator and have achieved a minimum GPA of 5.5 across at least 8 units of coursework, including at least 4 units from Part A.
prerequisites: Before enrolling students must obtain permission from the program coordinator and have achieved a minimum GPA of 5.5 across at least 8 units of coursework, including at least 4 units from Part A.
